categories.label: Depression
categories.description: As a patient, I have little interest or pleasure in doing things.

categories.label: Depression
categories.description: As a patient, I feel down, depressed and hopeless.

categories.label: Depression
categories.description: As a patient, I have trouble falling or staying asleep, or sleeping too much.

categories.label: Depression
categories.description: As a patient, I feel tired and have little energy.

categories.label: Depression
categories.description: As a patient, I have poor appetite, or eat too much.

categories.label: Depression
categories.description: As a patient, I feel bad about myself or think of myself as a failure, or have let myself or my family down.

categories.label: Depression
categories.description: As a patient, I have trouble concentrating on things such as reading the newspaper or watching television.

categories.label: Depression
categories.description: As a patient, I move and speak so slowly that other people could have noticed. Or the opposite, being so fidgety or restless that I move around a lot more than usual.

categories.label: Depression
categories.description: As a patient, I think that I would be better off dead, and thought of hurting myself.
